DataElement.preferredName: Molecular Analysis Tumor Marker Cell Assessment Lab Percentage ULN Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The numeric laboratory value representing the upper level of the normal range of values of the molecular analysis tumor marker cell assessment.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Molecular Analysis Tumor Marker Cell Assessment
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to assessment of the cells in the technique for studying or analyzing the genetic composition and mechanisms of living organisms at the molecular level with use of a substance sometimes found in an increased amount in the blood, other body fluids, or tissues and which may mean that a certain type of cancer is in the body.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Techniques for studying or analyzing the genetic composition and mechanisms of living organisms at the molecular level. May refer to the understanding and manipulation of genes (DNA).

Concepts.definition: A laboratory procedure that involves the study of tissues, cells, and fluids using DNA/RNA analysis techniques for the identification of characteristics and abnormalities at the molecular level.

Property.preferredDefinition: A substance sometimes found in an increased amount in the blood, other body fluids, or tissues and which may mean that a certain type of cancer is in the body. Examples of tumor markers include CA 125 (ovarian cancer), CA 15-3 (breast cancer), CEA (ovarian, lung, breast, pancreas, and gastrointestinal tract cancers), and PSA (prostate cancer). Also called biomarker.:The smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, composed of a membrane-enclosed mass of protoplasm and containing a nucleus or nucleoid. Cells are highly variable and specialized in both structure and function, though all must at some stage replicate proteins and nucleic acids, utilize energy, and reproduce themselves.:The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

Concepts.definition: A substance present in or produced by a tumor or by the host, that can be used for differentiating neoplastic from normal tissue based on measurements in body fluids, secretions, cells, and/or tissues. Markers are used in diagnosis, staging and prognosis of cancer, provide an estimation of tumor burden, and serve for monitoring effects of therapy, detecting recurrence, localization of tumors, and screening in general populations.
The smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, composed of a membrane-enclosed mass of protoplasm and containing a nucleus or nucleoid.
The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Lab Percentage Upper Limit of Normal Value
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The information contained in a data field of a fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator fo the top value of the range of statistical characteristics that are supposed to represent accepted standard, non-pathological pattern for particular laboratory result or other quantitative parameter.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Percentage Upper Limit of Normal Value
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Percentage; a fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.:The top value of the range of statistical characteristics that are supposed to represent accepted standard, non-pathological pattern for particular laboratory result or other quantitative parameter.:The information contained in a data field.

Concepts.definition: A fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.
The top value of the range of statistical characteristics that are supposed to represent accepted standard, non-pathological pattern for particular laboratory result or other quantitative parameter.
The information contained in a data field. It may represent a numeric quantity, a textual characterization, a date or time measurement, or some other state, depending on the nature of the attribute.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Versioned to changed the data type from character to number. AK 12/14/17
